Amtrak “overly focuses on protecting its proprietary data, solely determines resource allocations and planning decisions, and has no shared performance objectives. Costs cannot be rationally tied to actual service…. Due to these factors, service is declining.”

The private contractor “focuses on responsiveness, data sharing, collaboration and shared performance expectations. Costs are rational, correlated to actual service and developed jointly between the two partners. This service is growing.”

In today’s Amtrak hearing, Stacey Mortensen, Executive Director for San Joaquin Joint Powers Authority, tells a tale of two services – her experiences w/ commuter rail service operated by private contractor vs. route operated by Amtrak.
